name: Aggie Toppins / Critical Theory Cocktails
description: Aggie Toppins teaches graphic design at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga where she serves as Head of the Department of Art. Her Critical Theory Cocktails series combines new and classic cocktail recipes with short introductions to various philosophical themes. The visual language refers to vintage cocktail recipe pamphlets.

name: Art Metropole
description: Art Metropole is a not-for-profit organization based in Toronto, Canada, with a focus on the production, dissemination and contextualization of artist-initiated publication in any media, especially those formats and practices predisposed to sharing and circulation.

name: Awkward Ladies Club
description: Awkward Ladies Club is the imprint of Amy Burek, an Oakland-based artist who spends a lot of time thinking about LiveJournal. Her work explores how technology has shaped the way we communicate, interact with each other, and perceive ourselves. Let’s be friends on the internet!

name: Book and Job Gallery
description: b. 2012 : A photography space in the Tenderloin of San Francisco. Various photo shows and publications. A quarterly (ish) submission based film photo zine known as Find Rangers Camera Club. A black and white darkroom in the back closet.

name: Case Publishing / shashasha
description: Founded in 2015 with a focus on photography and contemporary art, Case Publishing made it its mission to expand the artbooks into a platform for an even richer variety of art forms. In September 2017, Case Publishing opened exhibition spaces in Tokyo and Rotterdam.

name: Wave Books
description: Wave Books is an independent poetry press based in Seattle, Washington, dedicated to publishing exceptional contemporary poetry, poetry in translation, and writing by poets.

name: Chin Music Press
description: A curiously bibliophilic indie publisher in historic Pike Place Market

name: Cold Cube Press
description: We are a Risograph publishing and printing company specializing in Art Books, abstract comics, poetry, and everything in between. Each year we put out a anthology of artists from all over the world, working in a variety of mediums.

name: CRISIS EDITIONS / DANE PRESS
description: Twin publishing ventures of artists Robin N. And Kitt Peacock, with the shared goal of redesigning and recirculating archival texts and materials. CRISIS EDITIONS focuses on socio-political and cyberspace related texts while DANE PRESS revives queer and mythic texts.

name: Desuetude
description: Desuetude is a contemporary art gallery, small press, and center for the arts. We nurture collaboration between locally and nationally recognized artists, performers, and writers in opposition to dominant culture.

name: Dropbox Design
description: We believe joy is the engine that powers all the best ideas. Dropbox Design is joining the Seattle Art Book Fair to celebrate joyful, creative ideas from across the creative community.

name: ECU Press / READ Books / Libby Leshgold Gallery
description: ECU Press publishes artists’ books, monographs, collected writings and music by local and international artists. READ Books is an award-winning bookstore specializing in artists' publications and art books. ECU Press and READ are both part of the Libby Leshgold Gallery at Emily Carr University of Art + Design in Vancouver

name: Entre Ríos Books
description: BETWEEN RIVERS. We publish collaborative work between Northwest poets, translators, artists & musicians. We also have an interest in publishing contemporary Argentinian poetry in translation. Gay-owned and queerly run since 2015.

name: Fillip
description: Fillip is a Vancouver-based arts publishing organization.

name: Frye Art Museum
description: Located in Seattle’s First Hill neighborhood since 1952, the Frye is the city’s only free art museum. The Frye reflects Seattle’s evolving identity through exhibitions, programs, and outreach, showcasing local and global artists who are exploring the issues of our time as well as contemporary scholarship on historical subject matter.

name: Half Table
description: Half empty? or Half full? Half Table is an art collective (table) that constantly invites artists for collaborating & sharing.

name: Henry Art Gallery
description: The Henry Art Gallery, located on the University of Washington campus, is internationally recognized for bold and challenging exhibitions, for being the first to premiere new works by established and emerging artists, and for highlighting contemporary art practice through multidisciplinary programs.

name: HOMOCATS
description: Created by Brooklyn artist J. Morrison in 2010, HOMOCATS is a visual art project connecting the modern popularity of the feline with social politics./nWe aim to fight phobias, propose equal rights, combat cultural stereotypes, question social norms, and resist the Trump administration.

name: horse gurl press
description: Born in West Virginia in 2015, horse gurl press is a fun DIY print press currently based in Eugene, Oregon. Printed with refurbished ink and recycled/found papers plus the vivid lively queer, weird, and natural subject matter always give the zines a distinct feel of love page after page. <3

name: IS Projects
description: IS Projects is a printmaking and book arts studio in Fort Lauderdale, FL whose mission is to promote innovations to print and book media by providing knowledge, training, and a supportive work space and publishes artists’ books through Existent Books, a residency and publishing initiative.

name: JAKLIN ROMINE
description: Jaklin Romine currently lives in East Los Angeles. She completed her Masters of Fine Arts at CalArts. I take over spaces and confront the intersection of feminist ideals that are formed by my identity as a disabled, queer, latinx, poc, living in the Southern California landscape.

name: John Akira Harrold
description: John is a multidisciplinary artist & designer with a fascination for print media, type, and contemporary artist books.

name: Joyce S. Lee
description: Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, my publishing practice largely focuses on technology's role in society, often taking a critical perspective to imagine alternative futures. I am particularly interested in how technology mediates communication and our understanding of the body.

name: Meshell Sturgis
description: Meshell is a Ph.D. Candidate in the Department of Communication and a Research Assistant for the Center for Communication, Difference, and Equity.  Her has a B.A. in English, with a Creative Writing minor and an M.A. in Cultural Studies.

name: MONDAY Art Journal | Jacob Lawrence Gallery
description:
MONDAY Art Journal is a biannual art journal produced by the Jacob Lawrence Gallery. MONDAY presents experiments in arts writing that anticipate the future directions of criticism. 

The Jacob Lawrence Gallery is the gallery of the University of Washington School of Art + Art History + Design.

name: Moniker Press
description: Moniker Press is a risograph print and publishing studio in Vancouver, BC, that works collaboratively with artists and writers to produce small editions of books, zines and print ephemera.

name: Monograph Bookwerks
description: Monograph Bookwerks is an art, object and ephemera bookstore based in Portland, OR focusing on contemporary art and artists, design, architecture, the avant-garde, counterculture and social/political activism, primarily from the 1960s to the present day.

name: Mortlake and Company
description: MORTLAKE AND COMPANY is a Seattle based bookshop, art gallery and home to Ouroboros Press. We offer a distinct selection of rare and curious books, feature a monthly art exhibition and host book launches and guest speakers on a wide range of esoteric subjects.

name: National Monument Press
description: National Monument Press is the Oakland based publishing project focused on supporting uniquely American stories through small edition printed matter, completed largely through collaboration with other artists.

name: Neoglyphic Media
description:
Neoglyphic Media is a publisher of comics, art, and visual media located in Bellingham, WA.

We are dedicated to publishing and promoting work from unique and visionary artistic innovators

name: New Documents
description: New Documents is a Los Angeles–based art book publisher.

name: New Laconic
description:
New Laconic presents contemporary findings in the form of books and art. We offer a space for research, serious irreverence, and inquisitive cross-disciplinary voices.

Drawing on our extensive shared history in the art and design fields, we treat each publication as a fresh experiment in design and bookmaking.

name: NIGHTED
description: NIGHTED (est. 2012) is a film photography platform and zine/ book publishing house based in the East Bay Area. Our goal is to show people the things that happen when the world's not watching.

name: Other Books and Zines
description: A community space and bookshop organized by Seite Books and Kaya Press. The programming and selection has an emphasis on literature in translation, POC creators in both literature and art, alternative comics, international art books and comics, independent presses, POC history, and the other in related contexts.

name: Paper Press Punch
description: Paper Press Punch is a community Risograph print and book studio located in Georgetown, Seattle. Run by artists Jessica Hoffman and Justin Quinlan, PPP does small batch printing for other artists in the Seattle area, in addition to hosting workshops, open studio print hours, and an annual residency.

name: play.ground
description: play.ground is a bicoastal collective leveraging art and design as tools of progressive social change. Under play.ground’s banner, we endeavor to steer a process-driven dialogue towards the environment, community, and the poetic play of language and life.

name: Publication Studio Vancouver
description: Publication Studio Vancouver prints and binds books on demand, creating original work with artists and writers we admire. We are part of an international network of Studios around the world. Publication Studio is a laboratory for publication in its fullest sense—not just the production of books, but the production of a public.

name: Push/Pull Press
description:
Push/Pull's mission is to promote underground art & comics - with a focus on building a sustainable community for the underground arts to thrive.

Push/Pull Press publishes the works of Push/Pull's members and selected guests. Titles include curated anthologies, poetry, comics & handmade books.

name: R. Baxter & Co.
description: Publishing small works at the intersection of educational/academic material and artists' books—with emphasis on: (1) collected and simultaneous narratives, (2) documentation of archives, research, and process, and (3) texts for open use.

name: Shortt Editions
description: Shortt Editions creates books, prints and editions that appropriate cultural norms, authority and rules. Shortt works with a mixture of Risograph and digital printing to create books that comment on the political aspects of the everyday. All works made by Paul Shortt.

name: SIB SIB BOOKS
description: SIB SIB BOOKS is a Los Angeles based art, design, and Riso studio founded by Sibba Hartunian. Publications focus on art books and artist’s activity books for all ages.

name: Small Editions
description: Based in Brooklyn, New York, Small Editions collaborates with contemporary artists to publish small edition bookworks and artists books. Building from a vibrant history of commissioned artists books, we seek to unite contemporary artmaking and book arts.

name: Storage book and film
description: We are an independent book shop in Seoul. We are selling and making independent books. I hope to have a chance to introduce of Korean Independent books. I'll bring illustrations books and photography books. I think that everyone can enjoy our books.

name: swampcone magazine
description: Quarterly print comix rag

name: The Bushwick Review
description: The Bushwick Review is a literary and art magazine that weaves together the work of more than 20 contributors in each issue. Our home base is Brooklyn, but our contributors live all over the world. We are interested in making art and writing that speaks to being alive in 2020.

name: The Idea of the Book
description: Our purpose is to promote the history and tradition of books and materials in the overlapping fields of art, design, and concrete poetry. We specialize in artists’ books, ephemera, prints, correspondence, and art from the 1960s onward.

name: UW Bothell MFA in Creative Writing & Poetics and Friends
description: The Master of Fine Arts in Creative Writing & Poetics at the University of Washington Bothell gives writers freedom to experiment across genres and media as suits their creative practice. Emphasizing experimentation and hybridity, we invite students to participate in a community concerned with writing and art in a rapidly changing society.

name: Veins + Arterys
description: Veins & Arterys is an independent publication press based on Unceded Coast Salish territory. Rooted in traditional printmaking methods and DIY zine culture, V&A seeks to collaborate and empower the voices of it’s contributors and team members.

name: Visual Communication Design / University of Washington
description: The VCD program prepares designers for the communication needs of industry and society. Emphasis is placed on the conception, creation, planning and realization of visual solutions to complex problems in contemporary culture. Students aim to create innovative visual ideas that inform, instruct and persuade the intended user.

name: Wolfman Books
description: Wolfman Books is a bookstore and small-press in Oakland, California. We are dedicated to publishing vibrant, critical non-fiction, poetry, small-run artist books and zine editions, as well as a quarterly magazine, Wolfman New Life Quarterly, exploring the intersection of arts and community in the Bay Area and beyond.

name: Yoffy Press
description: Yoffy Press is an independent publisher dedicated to pushing the boundaries of photobook publishing. Working in true partnership with artists, we look beyond the book as a container of images, integrating physical and conceptual design to create distinct art objects.
